formalParameter.description: Provide the name the virtual machine to be created.
Provide the path containing an installable distribution.
Indicate the CPU architecture of the virtual machine to be created. The default is i386.
Indicate the number of virtual processors in a virtual machine. The default is 1.
Indicate the size of the virtual machine's memory (in MB). The default is 512.
Indicate the capacity of the virtual disk (in GB). The default is 4.
Select a storage method to use. The default is 'pool'.
Provide the type of the device to use if the storage method selected is 'pool'. The default is 'disk'.
Select the format of the storage. The default is 'qcow2'. If you use the 'diskfile' storage method, some formats will not work (use 'raw').
Provide the path of the virtual disk to use if the storage method selected is 'diskfile'.
Provide the guest operating system type. The default is 'none'.
Select the operating system installation method.
Provide the network name or bridge device name.
Select the type of network to use. The default is 'bridge'.
Indicate the number of virtual machines to create. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the VM number ('_#').
Provide the name of the storage pool to use if the storage method selected is 'pool'.
Provide the host operating system IP address, to listen to for the VNC connection. Blank means the host's address.
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step

procedure.description: Store information about a virtual machine and create ElectricCommander resources

formalParameter.description: Provide the name the virtual machine to be created.
Indicate the number of virtual machines to create. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the VM number ('_#').
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.

step.description: Store information about a virtual machine and create ElectricCommander resources

formalParameter.description: Name of the virtual machine to destroy.
Indicate the number of virtual machines to destroy. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the VM number ('_#').
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
Provide the name of the virtual machine to start.
Indicate the number of virtual machines to start. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the VM number ('_#').
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.
Provide the name of the virtual machine to shut down.
Indicate the number of virtual machines to shut down. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the VM number ('_#').
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.

procedure.description: Moves a VM out of the suspended state.

formalParameter.description: Provide the name of the virtual machine to resume.
Indicate the number of virtual machines to resume. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the VM number ('_#').
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step
Moves a domain out of the suspended state.

formalParameter.description: Name of the virtual machine to suspend.
Number of virtual machines to suspend. If more than one, a suffix (_#) is added to vm names. Default: 1.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

procedure.description: Define a new guest with an identical virtual hardware configuration of any existing virtual machine.

formalParameter.description: Provide the name of the virtual machine to create.
Provide the name of the virtual machine to clone.
Indicate the number of clones to create. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the VM number ('_#').
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.
Provide the name of the virtual machine to take the snapshot from.
Provide the name of the snapshot to be created.
Provide the description of the snapshot to be created.
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.

step.description: Create a snapshot for a VM.

procedure.description: Revert the VM to the a snapshot specified.

formalParameter.description: Provide the name of the virtual machine to revert.
Provide the name of snapshot to use.
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.

step.description: Revert the VM to the a snapshot specified.

formalParameter.description: Provide the name of the virtual machine to clean up.
If checked, the virtual machine will be undefined.
Indicate the number of virtual machines to clean up. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the VM number ('_#').
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.

procedure.description: List all existing VMs by state

formalParameter.description: Provide the state of Virtual Machines to show. All shows all available virtual Machines this is the command '--all', inactive shows all the inactive machines this is the command '--inactive' and none to not specify any particular state.
Specify the step execution timeout length in minutes. Leave blank for no timeout.

step.description: List all existing VMs by state

formalParameter.description: Provide the name of the virtual machine to delete.
Indicate the number of virtual machines to delete. The default is 1. If the value is greater than 1, a suffix is added to VM names. The suffix consists of an underscore and the VM number ('_#').
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
